intro: Gymnocalycium ochoterenae, commonly known as the Ochoterenae moon cactus, is a species of cactus native to Argentina. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and its ability to produce striking, colorful flowers. The plant has a thick, fleshy stem that stores water, allowing it to survive in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in late summer or early autumn. Gymnocalycium ochoterenae is a popular choice for collectors due to its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
